intro: Streptocarpus albus subsp. albus, commonly known as the white streptocarpus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a succulent herb with fleshy, upright stems and opposite leaves. Its flowers are borne in terminal clusters and are known for their attractive, spurred petals. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant.
